extraExplanation: “reemployed”由前缀 re-（再一次）+ employed（被雇用的）构成，常见于人力资源与劳动市场语境，如裁员（laid off）后“再雇用”。
英美职场中也常用更口语的说法表达同一意思：be hired back / be brought back（被请回/被召回）。

summary.en: “Reemploying” means hiring someone again or using something again.
summary.zh: “reemploying”表示再次雇用某人，或再次使用某物。

definition.en: hiring someone again after a break (often a former employee).
definition.zh: （在一段间隔后）再次雇用某人（常指重新雇回原员工）。

examples.en: The company is reemploying workers who were laid off last year.
examples.zh: 公司正在重新雇用去年被裁员的工人。

examples.en: She was reemploying her old assistant for the busy season.
examples.zh: 为了旺季，她再次雇用了原来的助理。

definition.en: using something again, often for a new purpose.
definition.zh: 再次使用某物，常指用于新的用途。

examples.en: The team is reemploying existing data to build a new model.
examples.zh: 团队正在再次使用现有数据来建立新模型。

examples.en: We are reemploying the same strategy, but with better timing.
examples.zh: 我们在再次采用同一策略，但把握了更好的时机。

extraExplanation: “reemploying”是动词“reemploy”的现在分词/动名词形式，可表示正在发生的动作（be reemploying）或作为名词性用法（Reemploying workers takes time）。
写作中也常见拼写“re-employing”（加连字符）以便更清晰，但“reemploying”也完全正确。
在就业语境里常与“laid-off workers（被裁员工）”“reemployment（再就业）”等词一起出现。

summary.en: Reemployment means being employed again or hiring someone again, often after a layoff or time away from work.
summary.zh: Reemployment 指“再次雇用/重新就业”，常用于裁员后或离开工作一段时间后的再上岗情境。

definition.en: the act of employing someone again, or the state of being employed again (often after a layoff or a break from work)
definition.zh: 再次雇用；重新就业（常指裁员后或中断工作后的再上岗）

examples.en: The company offered reemployment to workers who were laid off last year.
examples.zh: 公司向去年被裁员的员工提供了重新雇用的机会。

examples.en: She applied for reemployment after her contract ended.
examples.zh: 合同结束后，她申请重新就业。

extraExplanation: “reemployment”常见于人力资源、劳动法和政府文件中；日常口语里也常用“get rehired（再被雇用）”或“go back to work（回去工作）”。
在一些语境中它可能暗示“回到原雇主”或“被同一单位再次录用”，但也可以泛指“重新获得工作”。具体含义要看上下文。
相关常见搭配：reemployment program（再就业项目）、reemployment assistance（再就业援助）、reemployment benefits（再就业相关福利/补助，视地区政策而定）。

summary.en: “Reemploys” means hires someone again, or uses something again.
summary.zh: “Reemploys”表示再次雇用某人，或（较正式地）再次使用某物。

definition.en: to hire someone again after a break, layoff, or the end of a contract
definition.zh: （在间隔、裁员或合同结束后）再次雇用某人

examples.en: After business improved, the company reemploys several workers who were laid off last year.
examples.zh: 业务好转后，公司重新雇用了几位去年被裁的员工。

examples.en: The school reemploys her each fall because she is an experienced substitute teacher.
examples.zh: 由于她是经验丰富的代课老师，学校每年秋天都会再次聘用她。

definition.en: to use something again for a purpose (often in formal or technical writing)
definition.zh: （常见于正式或技术语境）再次使用某物/重新用途

examples.en: The program reemploys old code to save time.
examples.zh: 这个程序再次使用旧代码以节省时间。

examples.en: The designer reemploys the same pattern in a new collection.
examples.zh: 设计师在新系列中再次使用同一图案。

extraExplanation: “reemploys”是动词“reemploy”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it reemploys）。常见搭配有：reemploy workers/staff；be reemployed by a company。词首re-表示“再、重新”。

summary.en: “Reen” is usually not a real standalone word; it’s most often a typo for “green” or part of “re-en-” forms like “re-enact.”
summary.zh: “reen”通常不是规范的独立单词；多为“green”的拼写错误，或出现在“re-en-”这类结构中（如 re-enact）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word in modern use; most often a misspelling of “green,” or part of a hyphenated form like “re-en-” (as in re-enact).
definition.zh: 现代英语中不是一个规范单词；最常见是把“green（绿色的）”拼错了，或出现在带连字符的“re-en-”结构中（如 re-enact 再现/再演）。

examples.en: I think you meant “green,” not “reen.”
examples.zh: 我觉得你想写的是“green”，不是“reen”。

examples.en: They will re-enact the scene from the movie.
examples.zh: 他们将再现电影里的那个场景。

extraExplanation:
“reen”在词典里很少作为独立词条出现；如果你是在聊天、作业或文章里看到它，通常需要根据上下文判断：
- 表示颜色时，几乎一定是“green”的拼写错误。
- 若出现在动词前并带连字符（re-en-），通常表示“再次/重新”，常见于 re-enact（再现/再演）、re-enter（重新进入）等。
如果你把包含“reen”的完整句子发我，我可以帮你判断你真正想表达的是哪一个词。

summary.en: Reenable means to enable something again—usually to restore a feature, setting, access, or permission after it was disabled.
summary.zh: Reenable 指“重新启用/恢复可用”，常用于把已停用的功能、设置、权限或许可再次打开。

definition.en: to make something able to work or be used again; to turn something back on after it was disabled
definition.zh: 重新启用；让某物在被停用后再次可用（重新打开/恢复功能）

examples.en: Please reenable two-factor authentication to keep your account secure.
examples.zh: 请重新启用双重验证，以确保你的账户安全。

examples.en: The update will reenable the feature that was turned off by mistake.
examples.zh: 这次更新会重新启用那个被误关闭的功能。

examples.en: IT had to reenable my access after my password reset.
examples.zh: 我重置密码后，IT 必须重新启用我的访问权限。

definition.en: to allow or authorize something again (often in official or legal contexts)
definition.zh: 再次批准；重新授权（常用于官方或法律语境）

examples.en: The committee voted to reenable funding for the program.
examples.zh: 委员会投票决定重新批准该项目的资金。

examples.en: The law was changed to reenable certain permits.
examples.zh: 法律被修改以重新允许某些许可证。

extraExplanation: “reenable”也常写作“re-enable”（加连字符），尤其在较正式的写作或编辑规范中；两者意思相同。
在科技/产品语境里，它通常等于“turn back on / restore / enable again”，常与 feature（功能）、account（账户）、access（权限）、setting（设置）搭配。

summary.en: Reenabled means something was turned back on or made available again.
summary.zh: Reenabled 表示把已关闭或禁用的东西重新开启、恢复可用。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle) made something active or available again after it had been disabled or turned off.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词）在被禁用或关闭后，使某物再次启用、恢复可用。

examples.en: The admin reenabled your account after verifying your identity.
examples.zh: 管理员在核实你的身份后，重新启用了你的账号。

examples.en: Notifications were reenabled in the app settings.
examples.zh: 在应用设置里重新启用了通知功能。

definition.en: (describing something) restored to an active or usable state.
definition.zh: （用于描述）已恢复启用状态的；已重新生效的。

examples.en: The reenabled feature is now visible on the main menu.
examples.zh: 重新启用的功能现在会显示在主菜单上。

examples.en: After the update, the reenabled security tools ran normally.
examples.zh: 更新后，重新启用的安全工具运行正常。

extraExplanation: “reenabled”来自动词“re-enable”（re- 表示“再次” + enable 表示“使能够/启用”）。写作时常见两种形式：re-enable（带连字符，更清晰、正式一些）和 reenable（不带连字符，科技/产品文档中也常见）。
在技术语境中，它常与 account / feature / service / notifications / permissions 等搭配使用，表示“恢复权限或功能”。

summary.en: Reenact means to act out a past event again, or (in law) to pass a law again/make it valid again.
summary.zh: Reenact 指把过去的事件再次表演重现；也可指（法律上）重新制定法律或使旧法再次生效。

definition.en: to act out a past event again (often to show what happened), especially in a performance, film, or for an audience
definition.zh: （常为展示或表演）把过去发生的事件再次表演/重现出来

examples.en: The students reenacted a scene from American history in class.
examples.zh: 学生们在课堂上重现了一段美国历史场景。

examples.en: The documentary asked witnesses to reenact what they saw.
examples.zh: 纪录片请目击者重现他们看到的情况。

examples.en: Every year, volunteers reenact the battle for visitors.
examples.zh: 每年志愿者都会为游客重现那场战役。

definition.en: (of a government or official body) to pass a law again, or make a previous law valid again
definition.zh: （政府/机构）重新制定（法律）；使旧法再次生效

examples.en: The legislature reenacted the law with minor changes.
examples.zh: 立法机构对该法律做了小幅修改后重新通过。

examples.en: The city council voted to reenact the policy next year.
examples.zh: 市议会投票决定明年让该政策重新生效。

extraExplanation: “Reenactment”在英语文化里很常见，尤其指“历史重演”活动：参与者穿着当时的服装、使用仿制道具来模拟某个历史时期或战役，常见于美国、英国的博物馆、纪念地等。
注意拼写：re-（再次）+ enact（制定/上演）。在法律语境中，enact=“制定法律”，所以 reenact 常用于“重新立法/让旧法恢复效力”。

summary.en: “Reenacted” means acted out or reconstructed again, often to recreate a past event or scene.
summary.zh: “Reenacted”表示把某个事件或场景再次表演或重现，常用于历史重演或还原现场。

definition.en: to perform or act out something again, especially an event from history, a scene, or a past situation
definition.zh: （尤指把历史事件、场景或过去发生的事）再次表演/重现

examples.en: The students reenacted the Boston Tea Party in class.
examples.zh: 学生们在课堂上重现了“波士顿倾茶事件”。

examples.en: Police reenacted the accident to understand what happened.
examples.zh: 警方通过重现事故来弄清发生了什么。

definition.en: shown again through a staged performance or reconstruction
definition.zh: 被再次上演的；被重现的

examples.en: We watched a reenacted scene from the old movie.
examples.zh: 我们观看了那部老电影的重现片段。

examples.en: The documentary included reenacted interviews to tell the story clearly.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片加入了重现式采访来更清楚地讲述故事。

extraExplanation: “reenact”常见于两类语境：①历史文化活动（历史重演/复刻，比如中世纪集市、南北战争重演）；②调查取证（警方或当事人“重现现场”以验证说法或还原过程）。
在法律/政治语境里，re-enactment 也可指“重新颁布（法律）”。不过日常里你看到的 reenacted 多半是“重演/重现”的意思。

summary.en: “Reenacting” means acting out something again—often to recreate an event (especially a historical one) or, in formal contexts, to pass a law again.
summary.zh: “Reenacting”指再次表演/重现某事（常见于历史事件重现），在正式语境中也可指重新通过某条法律。

definition.en: acting out an event or situation again, often to show what happened or to practice
definition.zh: 再次表演或重现某个事件/情境，常用于说明发生了什么或用于练习

examples.en: The students are reenacting a scene from the novel to understand the characters better.
examples.zh: 学生们正在重现小说中的一个场景，以便更好地理解人物。

examples.en: He was reenacting the accident for the police, explaining each step.
examples.zh: 他为警方重现事故经过，并解释每一步。

definition.en: recreating a past event as a performance, especially historical battles or daily life in a certain period
definition.zh: 以表演方式再现过去的事件，尤指历史战役或某个时代的生活场景

examples.en: They spent the weekend reenacting a Civil War battle in period clothing.
examples.zh: 他们穿着当时的服装，用周末时间重现了一场美国内战战役。

examples.en: The museum hosts reenacting events to bring history to life for visitors.
examples.zh: 博物馆举办历史重现活动，让观众更有身临其境的感觉。

definition.en: passing the same law again (legal or formal use)
definition.zh: （法律/正式用语）再次通过同一条法律，使其继续有效或以新形式恢复

examples.en: The legislature is reenacting the rule with minor changes.
examples.zh: 立法机构正对该规定作少量修改后重新通过。

extraExplanation: “reenacting”常见于“historical reenactment（历史重现）”语境：参与者会穿着特定年代的服装、使用道具与礼仪来模拟当时生活或战斗。这在美国、英国等地较常见，常用于教育与文化活动。

summary.en: Reenaction means acting out a past event again; the more common word is reenactment.
summary.zh: reenaction 指把过去的事件再演一遍；更常用的说法是 reenactment。

definition.en: the act of acting out a past event again (often for education or entertainment)
definition.zh: （为教育或娱乐）把过去事件再演一遍；重演

examples.en: The museum hosted a reenaction of a Civil War battle.
examples.zh: 博物馆举办了一场南北战争战役的重演活动。

examples.en: Students did a short reenaction to understand the historical scene.
examples.zh: 学生们做了一个简短的重演来理解历史情境。

definition.en: a performance or staged event that recreates something that happened before
definition.zh: 重演的表演／再现活动

examples.en: The reenaction was filmed for a documentary.
examples.zh: 这场重演被拍下来用于纪录片。

extraExplanation: “reenaction”较少见；更常用、也更标准的词是“reenactment”。在正式写作（新闻、学术、博物馆介绍）里通常用“reenactment”。
词根理解：re-（再次）+ enact（表演/使发生）→ reenact（重演）→ reenactment（重演活动）。

summary.en: Reenactment means recreating an event by performing or showing it again, often for history, education, or investigation.
summary.zh: Reenactment 指通过表演或再现来“重现”某个事件，常用于历史/教育活动或调查还原。

definition.en: a performance that shows an event again, often to teach, remember, or entertain (for example, a historical battle reenactment)
definition.zh: 对某个事件的再现表演，常用于教育、纪念或娱乐（如历史战役的重演）

examples.en: The museum hosted a reenactment of a Civil War camp to help visitors understand daily life.
examples.zh: 博物馆举办了一场美国内战营地的重演，帮助游客了解当时的日常生活。

examples.en: We watched a reenactment of the signing of the document during the anniversary celebration.
examples.zh: 在周年纪念活动中，我们观看了对文件签署仪式的重演。

definition.en: the act of doing or showing something again in a new situation, especially to recreate what happened (for example, reenactment of a crime for investigators)
definition.zh: 在新的情境中再次做/展示某事的行为，尤其是为了还原经过（如为调查而进行的犯罪过程重现）

examples.en: Police asked for a reenactment to better understand the timeline of the incident.
examples.zh: 警方要求进行过程重现，以更好地理解事件时间线。

examples.en: The documentary included a reenactment of key moments from the witness’s story.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片加入了对证人叙述关键时刻的情景再现。

extraExplanation: 构词法：re-（再次）+ enact（上演/使发生）+ -ment（名词后缀），字面意思是“再次上演”。
在英语文化中，“historical reenactment（历史重演）”很常见，参与者会穿着相应年代的服装、使用仿制道具，强调“尽量真实（authentic）”。
媒体语境里，crime reenactment / dramatic reenactment 常指电视剧或纪录片中的“情景再现”，可能由演员表演，不一定完全等同于真实影像。

summary.en: Reenactments are staged recreations of past events, especially for history, documentaries, or investigations.
summary.zh: Reenactments 指对过去事件的“情景再现/模拟重现”，常见于历史活动、纪录片或调查取证。

definition.en: performances that recreate a past event (often historical) to show what happened and what it felt like
definition.zh: 对过去事件（常为历史事件）的再现表演，用来展示当时发生了什么以及氛围与体验

examples.en: The museum hosts Civil War reenactments every summer.
examples.zh: 这家博物馆每年夏天都会举办南北战争的情景再现表演。

examples.en: The documentary used reenactments to help viewers understand the timeline.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片用情景再现帮助观众理解时间线。

definition.en: staged recreations used in investigations or media (for example, to show how a crime or accident might have happened)
definition.zh: 用于调查或媒体呈现的“模拟重现”（例如展示犯罪或事故可能如何发生）

examples.en: Police conducted reenactments to test different witness accounts.
examples.zh: 警方进行了模拟重现，以检验不同证人的说法。

examples.en: The TV show is known for dramatic crime reenactments.
examples.zh: 这档电视节目以戏剧化的犯罪情景再现而出名。

extraExplanation: “Reenactment”来自“re-（再、重新）+ enact（上演；使成为现实）”。在英语语境里，历史类 reenactments 常由爱好者穿着当时服装、使用仿制道具进行表演；而纪实节目里的 reenactments 通常会强调“可能发生的过程”，不一定完全还原细节。
常见搭配：historical reenactments（历史重现）、battle reenactments（战役重现）、crime/accident reenactments（犯罪/事故重现）、staged reenactment（摆拍式重现，偏中性或略带质疑语气）。

summary.en: “Reenacts” means “acts out a past event again” or “repeats/relives an experience or pattern.”
summary.zh: “Reenacts”表示“重演过去的事件”，也可指“重演/再经历某种经历或行为模式”。

definition.en: to act out a past event again (often for education, film, or historical interest)
definition.zh: 再现；重演（过去的事件，常用于教育、电影或历史活动）

examples.en: The actors reenacts the famous courtroom scene for the documentary.
examples.zh: 演员为纪录片重演了那段著名的法庭场景。

examples.en: Every year, the town reenacts a battle from its history.
examples.zh: 每年，这个小镇都会重演一场历史上的战役。

definition.en: to repeat or relive an experience or behavior pattern, often unintentionally
definition.zh: （常无意地）重演/再经历某种经历或行为模式

examples.en: He sometimes reenacts old arguments in his head.
examples.zh: 他有时会在脑海里重演以前的争吵。

examples.en: Without support, people may reenacts the same mistakes.
examples.zh: 如果缺少支持，人们可能会重蹈覆辙。

extraExplanation: “reenact”来自“re-（再次）+ enact（上演/制定）”。名词形式是“reenactment”，常见于历史复原活动（如重现独立战争战役）、影视中对案件或事件的“情景再现”。
常见搭配：reenact a scene/event/battle/crime（重演场景/事件/战役/案件）。在心理或日常语境里也可指“重演旧模式/旧创伤”（reenact a pattern/trauma），语气更偏抽象。

summary.en: Reenclose means to enclose something again, often by putting it back into an envelope or package.
summary.zh: Reenclose 指“再次封入/重新装入”，常用于把文件等重新放进信封或包裹中。

definition.en: to enclose again; to put something back inside an envelope, package, or other container (often used in letters and email attachments)
definition.zh: 再次封入；把某物重新放回信封、包裹或容器中（常用于信件/邮件场景）

examples.en: Please reenclose the signed form in the return envelope.
examples.zh: 请把已签署的表格重新放回回邮信封中。

examples.en: I forgot to include the receipt, so I reenclosed it with a new letter.
examples.zh: 我忘了附上收据，所以我把它和一封新信一起重新附上（封入）。

examples.en: If the document is missing, reenclose the attachment and resend the email.
examples.zh: 如果文件缺失，请重新附上附件并再次发送邮件。

extraExplanation: “reenclose”较常见于正式或商务语境，尤其是信件往来：表示“把文件/支票/回执等再次装入（随信）寄出”。在日常口语中，人们更常说“put it back in the envelope/package”。

summary.en: “Reenclosed” means enclosed again or put back into a closed space; it’s the past form of “re-enclose.”
summary.zh: “Reenclosed”表示“再次封闭/重新围住、重新装回封闭空间”，是“re-enclose”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of re-enclose) to enclose again; to put something back inside a closed space, boundary, or container.
definition.zh: （re-enclose 的过去式/过去分词）再次围住、再度封闭；把某物重新放回封闭的空间或范围内。

examples.en: After the inspection, the technician reenclosed the wires in the protective casing.
examples.zh: 检查完成后，技术员把电线重新封进保护套里。

examples.en: The museum reenclosed the artifact in a glass box to prevent damage.
examples.zh: 博物馆把文物重新封在玻璃盒里以防损坏。

examples.en: Please reenclose the form in the envelope before mailing it.
examples.zh: 请把表格重新装回信封再寄出。

definition.en: (as an adjective) enclosed again; shut in again.
definition.zh: （作形容词）再次被围住/被封闭的；重新封好的。

examples.en: The reenclosed garden was protected from strong winds.
examples.zh: 重新围起来的花园能抵挡大风。

examples.en: All samples must be reenclosed after testing.
examples.zh: 所有样品检测后必须重新封存。

extraExplanation: “reenclosed”常见于较正式或技术/书面语境（如工程、博物馆、文件流程）。日常口语中也可用更简单的表达：put back in / close again / seal it back up。
拼写上也常见作“re-enclosed”（带连字符），更清晰地表示“re-（再次）+ enclosed（封闭的）”。两种写法通常都能接受，但正式写作可优先考虑带连字符的形式以避免误读。

summary.en: “Reencloses” means “encloses again,” such as putting something back inside an envelope or re-fencing an area.
summary.zh: “Reencloses”意为“再次封入/重新围住”，如把东西重新装回信封或把一片区域重新围起来。

definition.en: to enclose again; to put something back inside a container, cover, or boundary
definition.zh: 再次封入；重新装入（容器/封套）；再度围住

examples.en: She reencloses the letter in a new envelope before mailing it.
examples.zh: 她把信重新装进一个新信封里再寄出。

examples.en: After checking the documents, the clerk reencloses them in the folder.
examples.zh: 核对完文件后，办事员把它们重新放回文件夹里。

definition.en: to enclose again with a fence or boundary (often used about land)
definition.zh: （常指土地）重新圈围；再次用篱笆/边界围起来

examples.en: The farmer reencloses the field after repairing the broken fence.
examples.zh: 农夫修好破损的篱笆后，把田地重新围起来。

examples.en: The park reencloses a damaged area to protect new plants.
examples.zh: 公园把受损区域重新围起来以保护新种的植物。

extraExplanation: “reencloses”是动词“reenclose”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it reencloses）。过去式和过去分词常见为“reenclosed”。
“enclose”除了“放进/装入”外，也常用于“圈地、围栏”。因此在农业、地产或城市规划语境中，第二个含义更常见。

summary.en: “Reenclosing” means enclosing something again—closing it back up or putting it back inside a boundary or container.
summary.zh: “Reenclosing”表示“再次封闭/重新围住”，即把东西重新封上或放回边界、容器之内。

definition.en: to enclose again; to put something back inside a closed space or within boundaries
definition.zh: 再次围住；重新把某物放回封闭空间或边界之内

examples.en: After repairing the wiring, the technician began reenclosing the panel.
examples.zh: 修好线路后，技术员开始把面板重新封上。

examples.en: The museum is reenclosing the artifact in a climate-controlled case.
examples.zh: 博物馆正在把这件文物重新放回恒温恒湿的展示柜中。

extraExplanation: “reenclosing”通常是动词“reenclose”的现在分词/动名词形式，意思是“再一次封闭/围住”。在技术、工程、包装、建筑等语境里更常见。
拼写上既可写作 reenclosing，也可写作 re-enclosing（较强调“re-”=再次）。日常写作里不加连字符更常见。

summary.en: Reencounter means to meet someone again, or to face/experience something again.
summary.zh: Reencounter 指再次遇见某人，或再次面对／经历某事。

definition.en: to meet someone again after not seeing them for some time
definition.zh: （久别后）再次遇见；重逢

examples.en: I reencountered my old classmate at the airport.
examples.zh: 我在机场又遇见了我的老同学。

examples.en: She reencountered the teacher who inspired her to study science.
examples.zh: 她重逢了那位激励她学习科学的老师。

definition.en: to face, experience, or come across something again (often a feeling, problem, or place)
definition.zh: 再次面对／经历／遇到（某种感受、问题或地方等）

examples.en: During the trip, he reencountered the same doubts he had years ago.
examples.zh: 在旅途中，他再次经历了多年前同样的疑虑。

examples.en: If we ignore the issue now, we may reencounter it later in a worse form.
examples.zh: 如果我们现在忽视这个问题，之后可能会以更糟的形式再次遇到它。

extraExplanation: “reencounter”由前缀 re-（再次）+ encounter（遇见、遭遇）组成，常用于书面语或较正式的表达；日常口语里更常说 “meet again” 或 “run into (someone) again”。
拼写上常见两种形式：reencounter（美式常见）与 re-encounter（用连字符强调构词）。

summary.en: “Reencountered” means “met again” or “came across again.”
summary.zh: “reencountered”意为“再次遇见/重逢”，也可指“再次碰到（同样的问题等）”。

definition.en: met someone again (past tense/past participle of “reencounter”), often by chance or after a period of time.
definition.zh: 再次遇见某人（“reencounter”的过去式/过去分词），常指隔了一段时间后或偶然重逢。

examples.en: I reencountered my high school teacher at the airport.
examples.zh: 我在机场重遇了我的高中老师。

examples.en: She was surprised to have reencountered an old friend from college.
examples.zh: 她很惊讶竟然重逢了一位大学时期的老朋友。

examples.en: We reencountered the same problem during testing.
examples.zh: 我们在测试时又遇到了同一个问题。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次”。“encounter”常带有“偶然遇到/碰上”的感觉，所以“reencounter”比“meet again”更强调“重逢/再度碰见（不一定事先约好）”。
在日常英语中，“run into … again”和“meet … again”更常见；“reencounter”更偏书面或叙述性写法。

summary.en: “Reencountering” means meeting or coming across someone or something again.
summary.zh: “reencountering”表示再次遇见或再次碰到某人/某事。

definition.en: meeting or coming across someone/something again (the present participle/gerund of “reencounter”)
definition.zh: 再次遇见；再次碰到（“reencounter”的现在分词/动名词）

examples.en: I wasn’t expecting to be reencountering my old teacher at the airport.
examples.zh: 我没想到会在机场再次遇到我以前的老师。

examples.en: Reencountering that song brought back a lot of memories.
examples.zh: 再次听到那首歌让我想起了很多回忆。

examples.en: They were reencountering the same problem after the update.
examples.zh: 更新之后他们又再次遇到了同一个问题。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次/重新”；“encounter”表示“偶遇、邂逅、遭遇”。因此“reencounter”常用于强调“时隔一段时间后又碰见（人/事物）”。
在日常英语里，“meet again”更口语、更常见；“reencounter”更偏书面或叙述语气（例如回忆、小说描写）。

summary.en: “Reencounters” means meetings with someone again, or (as a verb form) meets someone again.
summary.zh: “reencounters”表示“再次相见/重逢”（名词复数），也可作动词形式表示“再次遇见”。

definition.en: (plural noun) meetings with someone again after a time apart; second or later encounters
definition.zh: （复数名词）在分开一段时间后再次与某人相见；再次/多次相遇

examples.en: Their reencounters at family weddings were always warm and a little awkward.
examples.zh: 他们在家族婚礼上的再次相见总是温暖，却也有点尴尬。

examples.en: The book is built around a series of reencounters between the two old friends.
examples.zh: 这本书围绕两位老朋友的一连串重逢展开。

definition.en: (verb, third-person singular form of “reencounter”) meets someone again, often unexpectedly
definition.zh: （动词，为 reencounter 的第三人称单数）再次遇见（某人），常带有“意外重逢”的感觉

examples.en: In the second chapter, she reencounters her former teacher on a train.
examples.zh: 在第二章里，她在火车上再次遇见了她以前的老师。

examples.en: He reencounters the same problem every time he updates the app.
examples.zh: 他每次更新这个应用都会再次碰到同样的问题。

extraExplanation: “reencounter”由前缀 re-（再次）+ encounter（相遇/遭遇）构成。写法上有时也会见到带连字符的 “re-encounter”，意思相同；现代英语里不带连字符的写法更常见。

summary.en: Reencourage means to encourage someone (or support an idea) again, especially after confidence drops.
summary.zh: Reencourage 指“再次鼓励”，常用于对方失去信心后重新给予鼓励或重新推动支持。

definition.en: to encourage someone again (especially after they have lost confidence or motivation).
definition.zh: 再次鼓励（尤其是在对方失去信心或动力之后）。

examples.en: After the rejection, her teacher reencouraged her to keep applying.
examples.zh: 被拒绝后，老师再次鼓励她继续申请。

examples.en: We need to reencourage the team after last week’s loss.
examples.zh: 上周输球后，我们需要再次鼓励团队。

definition.en: to encourage again or renew support for an idea, plan, or behavior.
definition.zh: 重新鼓励/推动某个想法、计划或行为（使支持恢复或加强）。

examples.en: The campaign aims to reencourage people to use public transit.
examples.zh: 这项活动旨在重新鼓励人们乘坐公共交通。

examples.en: New evidence may reencourage investors to fund the project.
examples.zh: 新的证据可能会重新鼓励投资者为该项目提供资金。

extraExplanation: “reencourage”由前缀 re-（“再次、重新”）+ encourage 组成，意思直观，但在日常英语里不算高频。更常见的自然表达有：“encourage again / encourage … again”，“cheer someone up”，“reassure”，“renew confidence in…”。在正式写作中用 “reencourage” 也可以，但口语里通常会改用更常见的说法。

summary.en: “Reencouraged” means someone was encouraged again.
summary.zh: “reencouraged”表示“再次被鼓励/再次鼓励了某人”。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “reencourage”: to encourage someone again, especially after they lost confidence or motivation
definition.zh: “reencourage”的过去式/过去分词：再次鼓励某人，尤其是在对方失去信心或动力之后

examples.en: After the first rejection, her mentor reencouraged her to apply again.
examples.zh: 第一次被拒后，她的导师再次鼓励她重新申请。

examples.en: The coach reencouraged the team during halftime.
examples.zh: 中场休息时，教练再次鼓励了球队。

extraExplanation: “re-”这个前缀表示“再、重新”。“reencourage”在口语和写作中不算常见，更常见的表达是“encouraged … again / encouraged … once more / gave … renewed encouragement”。
拼写上“re- + encourage”会出现双元音连在一起（re-encourage），有时也写作“re-encouraged”来帮助阅读。

summary.en: Reencouragement means giving encouragement again—renewed support after someone feels discouraged.
summary.zh: Reencouragement 指“再次给予鼓励”，常用于人在沮丧或受挫后重新获得支持与信心。

definition.en: encouragement given again; renewed support or confidence after a setback.
definition.zh: 再次给予的鼓励；在受挫后重新给予的支持或信心。

examples.en: After the rejection, she needed some reencouragement to apply again.
examples.zh: 被拒绝后，她需要一些再次鼓励，才愿意再申请一次。

examples.en: A short message from his coach provided reencouragement before the next game.
examples.zh: 教练的一条简短信息在下一场比赛前给了他再次鼓励。

extraExplanation: “reencouragement”在日常英语中不算常见；更自然的表达通常是“renewed encouragement”“encouragement again”或“a boost of encouragement”。
书写上有时会看到带连字符的形式“re-encouragement”，用于让“再次”的意思更清晰，尤其在正式写作或需要强调时。

summary.en: Reencouraging means encouraging again—renewing support or confidence.
summary.zh: Reencouraging 指“再次鼓励”，即重新给予支持或信心。

definition.en: encouraging someone again; giving renewed support, confidence, or hope.
definition.zh: 再次鼓励；重新给予支持、信心或希望。

examples.en: After the setback, the coach focused on reencouraging the team before the next game.
examples.zh: 遇到挫折后，教练在下一场比赛前着重再次鼓励球队。

examples.en: She wrote a kind message, reencouraging her friend to keep applying for jobs.
examples.zh: 她写了一条暖心的信息，再次鼓励朋友继续投递工作。

definition.en: showing renewed encouragement (describing words, actions, or a situation).
definition.zh: （形容言语、行为或情境）再次带来鼓励的、重新振作人心的。

examples.en: His reencouraging tone helped everyone relax.
examples.zh: 他那种再次鼓励的语气让大家放松下来。

examples.en: A reencouraging update from the doctor gave the family hope.
examples.zh: 医生带来的一则令人重新振作的最新消息让家人看到了希望。

extraExplanation: “reencouraging”来自动词“re- + encourage（再次 + 鼓励）”，在日常英语中不算常见，很多时候更自然的说法是“encouraging again / offering encouragement again / reassuring”。
拼写上有时也会写作“re-encouraging”（加连字符）来强调“re-（再次）”。

summary.en: Reendorse means to endorse again—most often to renew public support for someone or something.
summary.zh: Reendorse 指“再次背书/再次支持”，最常用于重新公开支持某人或某事。

definition.en: to endorse again; to publicly give support or approval a second time (often for a candidate, plan, or product)
definition.zh: 再次背书；再次公开表示支持或认可（常用于候选人、计划或产品）

examples.en: The newspaper decided to reendorse the mayor for a second term.
examples.zh: 这家报纸决定再次背书这位市长，支持其连任。

examples.en: After the policy changes, several leaders reendorsed the proposal.
examples.zh: 在政策调整后，多位领导人再次表示支持该提案。

definition.en: (business/finance) to endorse again, especially by signing the back of a negotiable instrument (like a check) to transfer it to another person
definition.zh: （商业/金融）再次背书，尤指在可转让票据（如支票）背面再次签名以转让给他人

examples.en: The check had to be reendorsed before it could be deposited under the new account name.
examples.zh: 在新账户名下存入之前，这张支票需要再次背书。

extraExplanation: “reendorse”也常写作“re-endorse”。在新闻与政治语境里最常见，指媒体、组织或名人对同一位候选人/同一项立场在后续选举或新阶段“再次支持”。
金融语境较少见，通常与支票、票据的背书转让有关；不同机构对流程要求不同，实际操作需按银行或法律规定。

summary.en: “Reendorsed” means “endorsed again,” either re-supporting something or re-signing a check/document for processing.
summary.zh: “Reendorsed”意为“再次背书/再次支持”，可指再次表态支持某事，也可指在金融文件上再次签名以便办理。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle) to endorse again; to give approval or support again, often after a review or change.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词）再次背书；再次表示批准或支持，常见于复核或变更之后。

examples.en: After the policy was updated, the committee reendorsed it unanimously.
examples.zh: 政策更新后，委员会一致再次批准了它。

examples.en: Several community leaders reendorsed the candidate before the second round of voting.
examples.zh: 在第二轮投票前，多位社区领袖再次表态支持该候选人。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle, finance) to endorse (a check or document) again, typically by signing it so it can be transferred or processed.
definition.zh: （过去式/过去分词，金融）对（支票或文件）再次背书，通常指再次签名以便转让或办理。

examples.en: The check was returned and then reendorsed with the correct signature.
examples.zh: 支票被退回后，又补上正确签名重新背书。

examples.en: The bank asked the payee to reendorse the document before resubmission.
examples.zh: 银行要求收款人在重新提交前再次为文件背书。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”。“reendorsed”多见于正式语境（政治声明、机构决议、法律/金融文件）。
在银行语境里，英美也可能见到拼写“indorse”（较旧/较法律化的拼法），但日常更常用“endorse”。

summary.en: Reendorsement means endorsing again—renewing support or repeating an official endorsement, sometimes in finance as a renewed signature on a document.
summary.zh: Reendorsement 指“再次背书/重新认可”——重新表达支持或重复正式背书；在金融语境中也可指对文件的再次签署背书。

definition.en: the act of endorsing something again, or renewing official approval/support (for example, a candidate, a product, or a policy)
definition.zh: 再次背书；重新认可或公开支持（如对候选人、产品或政策）

examples.en: The senator’s reendorsement helped the candidate gain momentum.
examples.zh: 这位参议员的再次背书帮助候选人获得了更强的声势。

examples.en: After the updates, the committee voted for reendorsement of the program.
examples.zh: 更新之后，委员会投票决定对该项目重新认可。

definition.en: (business/finance) a renewed or additional signature/endorsement placed on a document, such as a check, to confirm or transfer rights again
definition.zh: （商业/金融）对文件（如支票）进行再次背书/补充背书，以再次确认或转移权利

examples.en: The bank requested reendorsement because the original signature was unclear.
examples.zh: 由于原始签名不清晰，银行要求重新背书。

examples.en: A reendorsement may be needed if a check is reissued or corrected.
examples.zh: 如果支票被重新开具或更正，可能需要再次背书。

extraExplanation: “Reendorsement”由前缀 re-（再次）+ endorsement（背书/支持）构成，常见于政治新闻（重新支持某人）以及金融或保险文件场景（再次签署确认）。在日常表达中，人们有时也会用更口语的说法，如 “endorse again / renew an endorsement”。

summary.en: “Reendorsing” means endorsing again—signing or showing support a second time, often for checks or updated statements.
summary.zh: “Reendorsing”指再次背书/再次签名或再次表示支持，常见于支票或更新后的声明。

definition.en: to endorse again; to sign or give approval/support again (often for a check, document, or public statement)
definition.zh: 再次背书；再次签名确认或再次表示支持/认可（常用于支票、文件或公开表态）

examples.en: The bank asked her to bring the check back for reendorsing because the first signature was unclear.
examples.zh: 银行让她把支票带回来重新背书，因为第一次签名不清楚。

examples.en: After the policy was revised, several organizations started reendorsing it publicly.
examples.zh: 政策修订后，一些组织开始公开再次表示支持。

extraExplanation: “endorse”在金融语境里常指在支票或票据背面签名以便转让或兑现；加上“re-”表示“再次/重新”。
在日常新闻或公共表达中，“reendorse”也可指在立场改变、文件更新或信息澄清后“再次背书/再次支持”。

summary.en: Reendow means to endow again—to provide renewed funding, property, or rights.
summary.zh: Reendow 指“再次设立/补充捐赠基金或重新授予财产、权利”。

definition.en: to give (someone or something) an endowment again; to provide again with money, property, rights, or qualities
definition.zh: 再次捐赠或授予（某人/某机构）基金、财产、权利或特质；使重新获得资助/资财

examples.en: The university launched a campaign to reendow the scholarship after its funding ran out.
examples.zh: 该大学发起募款活动，在奖学金经费耗尽后重新为其设立基金。

examples.en: After the reforms, the foundation was reendowed with new assets and a clearer mission.
examples.zh: 改革之后，该基金会被重新注入资产，并确立了更清晰的使命。

extraExplanation: “reendow”由前缀 re-（再次）+ endow（捐赠、设立基金、赋予）组成，意思很直观，但在日常英语中较少见。
常见于正式语境，如大学/教会/慈善机构的基金（endowment）恢复或重设，以及法律或历史叙述中“重新授予财产或特权”。日常表达里更常用：refinance, restore funding, endow again, provide new funding。

summary.en: Reendowed means given a new endowment again—renewed long-term financial support.
summary.zh: reendowed 指“重新设立（捐赠）基金”，即再次获得长期资金支持。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of reendow) to give an organization, project, or person an endowment again; to provide new long-term funding or resources after they were reduced or lost.
definition.zh: （reendow 的过去式/过去分词）再次捐赠设立基金；在资金被削减或失去后，为机构/项目/个人重新提供长期资金或资源。

examples.en: After the war, several colleges were reendowed by private donors.
examples.zh: 战后，一些学院在私人捐助者的支持下重新设立了基金。

examples.en: The museum was reendowed so it could maintain its free public programs.
examples.zh: 博物馆获得重新设立的基金，从而能维持对公众免费的项目。

definition.en: (often used as an adjective) having been given a new endowment or renewed financial support.
definition.zh: （常作形容词）已被重新设立基金的；获得了新的/恢复的长期资助的。

examples.en: The reendowed foundation expanded scholarships for first-generation students.
examples.zh: 这家获得重新基金支持的基金会扩大了对第一代大学生的奖学金。

examples.en: A reendowed program can plan for the future with more stability.
examples.zh: 一个重新获得基金支持的项目能更稳定地规划未来。

extraExplanation: “endow / endowment”在英语里常指给大学、博物馆、慈善机构等设立“捐赠基金/基金会资金”，通常会投资并用收益来长期运作；因此 reendowed 多见于教育、文化与慈善语境。
拼写上 re- + endow 合在一起写作 reendow / reendowed（中间不需要连字符），但在少数出版物中也可能见到 re-endowed 的写法。

summary.en: “Reendowing” means providing an endowment again—restoring or renewing long-term funding (often for an institution).
summary.zh: “Reendowing”指再次设立或恢复捐赠基金，即为机构等重新提供长期资助。

definition.en: giving money, property, or a special quality to someone or an institution again; restoring an endowment or funding.
definition.zh: 再次向某人或某机构捐赠资金/财产或赋予某种特质；恢复（或重新设立）基金/捐赠。

examples.en: The university discussed reendowing the scholarship after years of budget cuts.
examples.zh: 在多年的预算削减之后，大学讨论重新为该奖学金设立捐赠基金。

examples.en: A group of alumni is reendowing the program so it can hire new teachers.
examples.zh: 一群校友正在为该项目重新注资捐赠基金，以便它能聘请新教师。

extraExplanation: “reendowing”来自动词 reendow（re- 表示“再一次” + endow 表示“捐赠/赋予”）。在英语里更常见的表达是 “endow again” 或 “restore/reestablish an endowment”，因此这个词较少见，多出现在正式语境（如大学、博物馆、基金会等谈财务捐赠与基金恢复时）。
endowment（捐赠基金）通常指把一笔钱或资产长期投入，由投资收益来持续支持某个职位、奖学金或项目；因此 reendow 常暗示“恢复长期、可持续的资助”。

summary.en: Reendowment means giving a new or renewed endowment—funding or assets provided again, especially to support an institution long-term.
summary.zh: reendowment 指“再次捐赠/重新设立捐赠基金”，即再次提供资金或资产，以长期支持某个机构。

definition.en: the act of giving money, property, or other support again (or anew), especially to an institution such as a school, museum, or charity; a new endowment
definition.zh: （尤指对学校、博物馆、慈善机构等）再次捐赠/重新设立基金；再度资助

examples.en: The university announced a reendowment of its scholarship fund after years of inflation.
examples.zh: 这所大学宣布对奖学金基金进行重新注资，以应对多年的通货膨胀。

examples.en: Local donors supported the reendowment of the community library, helping it modernize its services.
examples.zh: 当地捐赠者支持社区图书馆的再度资助，帮助它升级服务。

extraExplanation: “endowment”常指捐给机构的一笔本金（或资产），通常会被投资；机构多使用投资收益来长期运作。reendowment 则强调“再次补充/重新设立这笔长期基金”，常见于高校、基金会、宗教机构等语境。

summary.en: “Reendows” means “endows again”—gives funding, rights, or qualities once more.
summary.zh: “reendows”表示“再次捐赠／再度赋予”，把资金、权利或特质重新给予。

definition.en: to endow again; to provide someone or something with money, property, rights, or qualities once more (third-person singular present of “reendow”)
definition.zh: 再次捐赠／再度赋予；把资金、财产、权利或某种特质再次给予某人或某事（“reendow”的第三人称单数现在时）

examples.en: The donor reendows the scholarship fund after it runs low.
examples.zh: 当奖学金基金快见底时，捐赠者再次为其注资。

examples.en: The reform reendows local councils with decision-making power.
examples.zh: 这项改革把决策权再次赋予地方议会。

extraExplanation: “reendows” = re-（再次）+ endow（捐赠、赋予）。这个词在现代英语中比较少见，更常见的表达是 “endow again / re-establish funding / restore powers”。
用在“资金／基金”语境时，reendow 常指再次提供捐款让基金恢复运作；用在“权力／资格／特质”语境时，则接近 “restore / regrant（恢复、重新授予）”。

summary.en: Reenergize means to regain energy or to give new energy and enthusiasm to someone or something.
summary.zh: reenergize 指“恢复精力”，或“让某人/某事重新充满活力与热情”。

definition.en: to give someone or something new energy, strength, or enthusiasm; to make active again
definition.zh: 让某人/某物重新获得能量、力量或热情；使恢复活力

examples.en: A short walk outside can reenergize you after a long meeting.
examples.zh: 长时间开会后，到外面走一小会儿能让你重新充满精力。

examples.en: The company reenergized its brand with a new logo and a clearer message.
examples.zh: 公司通过新标志和更清晰的品牌信息让品牌重新焕发活力。

definition.en: (of a person or thing) to become energetic again; to regain strength or enthusiasm
definition.zh: （人或事物）重新变得精力充沛；恢复体力或热情

examples.en: After a quick lunch, she reenergized and finished the report.
examples.zh: 快速吃过午饭后，她恢复精神，把报告写完了。

examples.en: We need a weekend to rest and reenergize.
examples.zh: 我们需要一个周末休息一下，恢复精力。

extraExplanation: 前缀 re- 表示“再次/重新”，energize 表示“给……注入能量、激励”。因此 reenergize 很常用于健康与职场语境：reenergize yourself（给自己充电）、reenergize a team/plan（重振团队/计划）。
拼写上也常见 re-energize（带连字符）或英式拼写 re-energise，但在美式英语里 reenergize 最常见。

summary.en: Reenergized means “energized again”—refreshed and full of new energy, or made active again.
summary.zh: reenergized 表示“再次充满精力/恢复活力”，也可指“使（人或事物）重新振作”。

definition.en: Feeling energized again; refreshed and full of new energy.
definition.zh: 重新充满精力的；恢复精神的。

examples.en: After a short break, I felt reenergized and ready to work.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，我感觉重新充满精力，准备继续工作。

examples.en: The weekend trip left her reenergized for the new week.
examples.zh: 周末旅行让她为新的一周恢复了精神。

definition.en: To give someone or something new energy; to make active or strong again.
definition.zh: 使重新获得能量；使重新振作、恢复活力。

examples.en: A clear goal can reenergize the whole team.
examples.zh: 一个明确的目标能让整个团队重新振作。

examples.en: He reenergized himself with a quick walk outside.
examples.zh: 他到外面快走了一会儿，让自己重新提起精神。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再一次/重新”。因此 reenergized = re-（重新）+ energized（充满能量的）。
在职场语境里，reenergize 常用于谈“士气/动力/团队氛围”的回升，如 reenergize the team / reenergize the project。日常也常搭配 break, rest, walk, coffee 等表达“提神、恢复精力”。

summary.en: “Reenergizes” means “gives energy again; revives,” used with he/she/it.
summary.zh: “reenergizes”意为“让……重新充满能量/恢复活力”，用于 he/she/it 的现在时。

definition.en: to give new energy or strength to someone or something again; to revive
definition.zh: 使（人或事物）重新充满能量；使恢复活力

examples.en: A short walk after lunch reenergizes me for the afternoon.
examples.zh: 午饭后短走一会儿会让我重新有精力应付下午。

examples.en: The coach’s speech reenergizes the team before the second half.
examples.zh: 教练的讲话让球队在下半场开始前重新振作起来。

examples.en: Changing the lighting reenergizes the space and makes it feel more welcoming.
examples.zh: 更换照明让空间焕然一新，更显温馨有活力。

extraExplanation: “reenergizes”是动词“reenergize”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it reenergizes）。常见搭配：reenergize the team/company/campaign（让团队/公司/活动重获活力）；reenergize yourself（让自己恢复精力）。
词缀提示：re- 表示“再、重新”，energize 表示“给……注入能量/使有活力”，合起来就是“重新注入能量”。

summary.en: Reenergizing means making you feel energized again—refreshed, motivated, and ready to continue.
summary.zh: Reenergizing 指“让你重新充满精力”，变得更清醒、更有动力，能够继续投入。

definition.en: giving someone or something new energy or enthusiasm again; making them feel refreshed and motivated
definition.zh: 重新注入能量或热情；让人（或事物）恢复精神、变得更有动力

examples.en: A short walk outside can be reenergizing after a long meeting.
examples.zh: 开了很久的会后，到外面走一小会儿会让人重新有精神。

examples.en: She took a reenergizing nap and finished her work later that night.
examples.zh: 她睡了个恢复精力的小觉，晚上又把工作做完了。

examples.en: The new project felt reenergizing for the whole team.
examples.zh: 这个新项目让整个团队都重新振作起来。

extraExplanation: “reenergizing”通常作形容词，描述某件事带来的效果（让人恢复精力）。也常见拼写为“re-energizing”。动词形式是“reenergize”（再次给予能量/使恢复活力）。
常用搭配：reenergizing break（提神的休息）、reenergizing drink（让人恢复精力的饮料）、reenergizing routine（让人重新充满动力的习惯/作息）。在工作与学习语境里，这个词带有积极、鼓舞的语气。

summary.en: Reinforce means to strengthen something or to send extra support.
summary.zh: Reinforce 表示“加强/加固”，也可表示“增援、追加支援”。

definition.en: to make something stronger or more stable; to support or strengthen an idea, feeling, or structure
definition.zh: 加强；加固；强化（想法、感情或结构等）

examples.en: They reinforced the bridge with steel beams.
examples.zh: 他们用钢梁把桥加固了。

examples.en: Daily practice will reinforce what you learn in class.
examples.zh: 每天练习会强化你在课堂上学到的内容。

examples.en: The teacher’s praise reinforced her confidence.
examples.zh: 老师的表扬增强了她的自信。

definition.en: to send additional people, equipment, or supplies to help an area or group (often in military, police, or emergency contexts)
definition.zh: 增援；派更多人手/装备/物资支援（常用于军警或紧急情况）

examples.en: The firefighters were reinforced with crews from a nearby city.
examples.zh: 消防队得到了来自附近城市的队伍增援。

examples.en: The company reinforced the customer service team during the holiday rush.
examples.zh: 公司在节日高峰期为客服团队增派人手。

extraExplanation: 你写的“reenforce”通常是拼写错误；标准拼写是 **reinforce**（中间是 *in*，不是 *en*）。
词源上 *rein-* 有“再次/加强”的感觉，和 *force*（力量）结合起来就有“把力量加上去→加强/加固”的意思。常见搭配：reinforce a rule（强化规则），reinforce learning（巩固学习），reinforce a team（增援团队）。

summary.en: Reinforced means “made stronger,” and it is also the past form of reinforce.
summary.zh: reinforced 意为“加固的/加强的”，也可作 reinforce 的过去式。

definition.en: Strengthened or made more resistant by adding support, material, or extra power.
definition.zh: （通过增加支撑、材料或力量而）加固的；加强的。

examples.en: The bridge has reinforced concrete pillars to handle heavy traffic.
examples.zh: 这座桥有钢筋混凝土桥墩来承受繁重的交通。

examples.en: Wearing reinforced shoes can protect your feet on rocky trails.
examples.zh: 穿加固鞋可以在多石的小路上保护你的脚。

definition.en: Past form of “reinforce”: to make something stronger, more stable, or more effective.
definition.zh: reinforce 的过去式：加强；加固；使更有效。

examples.en: They reinforced the wall with steel beams after the earthquake.
examples.zh: 地震后他们用钢梁加固了墙体。

examples.en: The teacher reinforced the rule by repeating it every day.
examples.zh: 老师每天重复这条规则来强化它。

extraExplanation: 你写的 **reenforced** 通常是拼写错误；标准拼写是 **reinforced**（re- + enforce/force）。常见错误点是把中间的 **in** 漏掉或写成 **een**。
在工程语境里，**reinforced concrete** = “钢筋混凝土”（用钢筋加强混凝土）；在学习/心理学语境里，**reinforcement** 指“强化/强化物”，如奖励来强化行为。

summary.en: Reinforcement means strengthening something, or sending extra support; in psychology, it’s something that increases a behavior.
summary.zh: Reinforcement 指“加强/加固”或“增援”；在心理学中指能增加某行为发生概率的“强化”。

definition.en: the act of making something stronger or more effective; added support
definition.zh: 加强；加固；强化（使某事更牢固或更有效的行为或支持）

examples.en: The bridge needs reinforcement to handle heavier traffic.
examples.zh: 这座桥需要加固，才能承受更重的车流。

examples.en: Positive feedback can be a reinforcement for good habits.
examples.zh: 积极的反馈可以强化好的习惯。

definition.en: additional people, resources, or equipment sent to help, especially in the military or emergencies
definition.zh: 增援；援军；支援力量（尤指军事或紧急情况下追加的人力物资）

examples.en: The firefighters asked for reinforcement when the wind got stronger.
examples.zh: 风势变强后，消防员请求增援。

examples.en: The team brought in reinforcements to finish the project on time.
examples.zh: 团队引入了额外人手作为支援，以按时完成项目。

definition.en: in psychology and learning, a reward or consequence that makes a behavior more likely to happen again
definition.zh: （心理学/学习）强化物；强化（使某行为更可能再次发生的奖励或后果）

examples.en: Giving a child praise is a common form of reinforcement.
examples.zh: 夸奖孩子是一种常见的强化方式。

examples.en: The app uses reinforcement—points and badges—to keep users practicing.
examples.zh: 这个应用用强化机制——积分和徽章——来让用户持续练习。

extraExplanation: 拼写提示：更常见的拼写是 reinforcement（rein-），你输入的 reenforcement 也是可接受的变体拼写，但在现代美式英语里较少见。
词源理解：rein- 有“再、回、加强”的意思（来自法语/拉丁语系统），force 是“力量”，-ment 表示“行为/结果”，合起来就是“使力量增强的行为或结果”。
学习理论里常见搭配：positive reinforcement（正强化，给奖励）、negative reinforcement（负强化，移除不愉快刺激以增加行为；注意它不是 punishment/惩罚）。

summary.en: “Reinforces” means “makes stronger” (physically or as support for an idea/feeling). It is the third-person singular form of “reinforce.”
summary.zh: “reinforces”表示“使更强、加强/巩固（结构或观点/感受）”，是动词“reinforce”的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: to make something stronger, more solid, or more effective; to support an idea or feeling with extra proof or emphasis
definition.zh: 加强；巩固；使更有力；（用证据/强调）支持、强化某个观点或感受

examples.en: Regular practice reinforces good habits.
examples.zh: 经常练习会强化好习惯。

examples.en: The new evidence reinforces the police officer’s story.
examples.zh: 新证据进一步支持了警官的说法。

examples.en: Her teacher’s praise reinforced her confidence.
examples.zh: 老师的表扬增强了她的自信。

definition.en: to add extra material or support so something can hold more weight or resist damage (e.g., a building, wall, or fabric)
definition.zh: （加固结构/材料）使更牢固、更能承重或更耐损

examples.en: They reinforced the bridge after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨后他们对桥梁进行了加固。

examples.en: This backpack has reinforced straps.
examples.zh: 这个背包的背带做了加固处理。

extraExplanation: 你写的 **reenforces** 常见是拼写错误；正确拼写是 **reinforces**，来自动词 **reinforce** 的第三人称单数（he/she/it reinforces）。
词形小提示：**re-**（再次/加强）+ **in** + **force**（力量）→ “把力量加进去”，引申为“加强/巩固”。
常见搭配：reinforce an idea/belief（强化观点/信念），reinforce learning（强化学习效果），reinforce security（加强安保），reinforced concrete（钢筋混凝土）。

summary.en: Reenforcing is usually a misspelling of reinforcing: making something stronger or more effective by adding support or repeating support.
summary.zh: Reenforcing通常是reinforcing的拼写误写：指通过增加支撑或反复支持来使某物更牢固或更有效。

definition.en: (Common spelling: reinforcing) strengthening something or making it more effective by adding support, material, or encouragement.
definition.zh: （常见拼写：reinforcing）通过增加支持、材料或鼓励来加强某物，使其更牢固或更有效。

examples.en: The steel bars are reinforcing the concrete.
examples.zh: 钢筋在加固混凝土。

examples.en: Her teacher’s praise was reinforcing her confidence.
examples.zh: 老师的表扬在增强她的自信心。

examples.en: They shared extra training videos to provide reinforcing practice.
examples.zh: 他们分享了额外的训练视频来提供巩固练习。

definition.en: present participle of “reinforce”: to make something stronger; to add support; to strengthen an idea or feeling by repeating or supporting it.
definition.zh: “reinforce”的现在分词：使更坚固；加强支撑；通过重复或支持来强化某种想法或感受。

examples.en: Engineers are reinforcing the bridge after the storm.
examples.zh: 工程师正在风暴后加固这座桥。

examples.en: The article is reinforcing the message that sleep matters.
examples.zh: 这篇文章在强化“睡眠很重要”的信息。

extraExplanation: “reenforcing”通常被认为是拼写错误；标准拼写是reinforcing（rein- + force）。
reinforce既可以指“物理加固”（如钢筋加固建筑），也常用于“抽象强化”（如强化观点、信心、规则）。

summary.en: Reengage means to connect or participate again after a break.
summary.zh: Reengage 指在中断后重新联系或重新参与。

definition.en: To start communicating or working with someone again, especially after a pause or conflict.
definition.zh: （在中断或矛盾后）重新与某人联系/重新开展合作或沟通。

examples.en: After a few months apart, she decided to reengage with her old friends.
examples.zh: 分开几个月后，她决定重新和老朋友们联系。

examples.en: The company is trying to reengage customers who stopped using the app.
examples.zh: 这家公司正试图重新吸引那些不再使用该应用的客户。

definition.en: To become involved again in an activity, effort, or process; to return to active participation.
definition.zh: 重新投入到某项活动/努力/进程中；恢复积极参与。

examples.en: He took a short break and then reengaged with the project.
examples.zh: 他短暂休息后又重新投入到这个项目中。

examples.en: Try to reengage in exercise slowly after you’ve been sick.
examples.zh: 生病后恢复运动要循序渐进地重新开始。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次、重新”。“reengage”常见于职场与公共沟通语境：如 reengage customers（重新唤回客户）、reengage employees（重新调动员工积极性）、reengage with the community（重新与社区建立联系）。
常见搭配：reengage with + 人/组织/话题（重新与……互动）；reengage in + 活动（重新参与……）。

summary.en: Reengaged means became involved again or renewed interest/attention; less commonly, became engaged to marry again.
summary.zh: reengaged 表示“再次参与/重新投入、重新产生兴趣或专注”；较少见时可指“再次订婚”。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of reengage: to become involved again, or to renew attention/interest in something or someone
definition.zh: reengage 的过去式/过去分词：再次参与；重新把注意力/兴趣投入到某事或某人上

examples.en: After the break, the students reengaged with the lesson.
examples.zh: 休息后，学生们重新投入到课程中。

examples.en: The company reengaged former customers through a new email campaign.
examples.zh: 公司通过新的邮件活动重新吸引了老客户。

examples.en: He reengaged in his hobby after years of being too busy.
examples.zh: 多年忙碌之后，他又重新拾起了自己的爱好。

definition.en: (often as an adjective) involved or connected again; renewed in focus, effort, or interest
definition.zh: （常作形容词）再次投入的；重新建立联系的；注意力/努力/兴趣恢复的

examples.en: She seemed reengaged and eager to contribute.
examples.zh: 她看起来重新投入，并且很愿意做出贡献。

examples.en: A reengaged audience asked more questions during the talk.
examples.zh: 重新投入的听众在演讲中问了更多问题。

definition.en: (less common) engaged to be married again
definition.zh: （较少见）再次订婚

examples.en: After years apart, they reconnected and later reengaged.
examples.zh: 分开多年后，他们重新联系，后来又再次订婚。

extraExplanation: “reengage”常见拼写也可以写作“re-engage”（带连字符），含义不变；在商业和教育语境里很常用，表示“把人重新拉回到参与状态”（例如重新吸引客户、让学生重新专注）。

summary.en: Reengagement means engaging again—renewed participation or, in marketing, efforts to win back inactive users or customers.
summary.zh: Reengagement 指“再次参与/重新投入”；在营销中常指“召回”不活跃用户或客户的行动。

definition.en: the act or process of engaging again; renewed participation, interest, or connection after a break
definition.zh: 重新参与；再度投入；在中断后恢复参与、兴趣或联系的过程

examples.en: The program focuses on student reengagement after long absences.
examples.zh: 这个项目关注长期缺课后学生的重新投入。

examples.en: Regular check-ins helped with employee reengagement.
examples.zh: 定期沟通有助于员工重新投入工作。

definition.en: (business/marketing) efforts to win back people who stopped responding, such as customers or app users
definition.zh: （商业/营销）召回不再回应的人群（如客户、用户）的行动或策略

examples.en: We ran a reengagement email campaign to bring inactive users back.
examples.zh: 我们开展了召回邮件活动，让不活跃用户回归。

examples.en: The app sent reengagement notifications after 30 days of inactivity.
examples.zh: 该应用在用户30天未使用后发送召回通知。

extraExplanation: 这个词常见两种拼写：reengagement（更常见于美式写法）和 re-engagement（更强调“再次参与”的构词结构）。在正式写作里两者都可接受，但同一篇文章建议统一。
在产品/增长语境中，reengagement 常与 campaign（活动）、email（邮件）、push notification（推送）、win-back（召回）等搭配；含义通常偏“把流失/沉默用户拉回来”。

summary.en: “Reengages” means returns to engaging again, or (for systems) connects/works again.
summary.zh: “reengages”表示“再次参与/重新投入”，也可指（系统、装置）“重新接合或恢复运作”。

definition.en: to begin engaging again; to return to an activity, relationship, or process after a pause
definition.zh: 再次参与；在中断后重新回到某项活动、关系或流程中

examples.en: After a short break, she reengages with the lesson and starts taking notes again.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，她重新投入课程，又开始做笔记。

examples.en: The company reengages with customers by answering questions online.
examples.zh: 这家公司通过在线答疑来重新与顾客建立互动。

definition.en: (of a device or system) to connect or start working again
definition.zh: （设备或系统）重新接合；再次连接或恢复运作

examples.en: If the safety system reengages, the machine will stop automatically.
examples.zh: 如果安全系统重新启动，机器会自动停止。

examples.en: The clutch reengages smoothly when you release the pedal.
examples.zh: 当你松开踏板时，离合器会平稳地重新接合。

extraExplanation: “reengages”是动词第三人称单数（he/she/it reengages）。常见原形是“reengage”。
拼写上也常见“re-engage”（带连字符），两者意思相同；正式写作中两种都可见，是否加连字符多取决于编辑风格。

summary.en: Reengaging means getting involved again or reconnecting after a break; it can also mean a machine or system connecting/working again.
summary.zh: reengaging 指在中断后重新参与或重新建立联系；也可指机械/系统重新接合或恢复运作。

definition.en: starting to take part in something again, or reconnecting with someone after a pause or break
definition.zh: 重新开始参与某事；（在中断后）重新与某人建立联系/互动

examples.en: After taking a short break, she is reengaging with her studies.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，她又重新投入到学习中。

examples.en: The company is reengaging customers through a new email campaign.
examples.zh: 这家公司通过新的邮件活动重新拉回顾客。

examples.en: He’s reengaging in the conversation now that he feels calmer.
examples.zh: 他感觉平静下来后，又重新加入对话。

definition.en: (of a device or mechanism) connecting or working again after being stopped or disconnected
definition.zh: （设备/机械）在停止或断开后再次接合、重新运作

examples.en: The driver felt the clutch reengaging as he let the pedal up.
examples.zh: 他松开离合踏板时，感觉离合器重新接合了。

examples.en: Wait for the system to reboot before the safety lock starts reengaging.
examples.zh: 等系统重启后，安全锁才会开始重新启用。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次、重新”。所以 reengage = engage（参与/吸引/接合）+ re-（再次）。
拼写上常见为 reengage / reengaging（美式常用）；有时也会看到 re-engage / re-engaging（用连字符强调结构，含义相同，较正式或编辑风格所致）。
在职场沟通里，reengage 常指“重新调动兴趣/恢复联系”（如 reengage employees/customers）；在工程语境里，常指零件“重新接合”。

summary.en: “reenge” isn’t a standard word; you probably mean “reengage,” meaning to get involved again or renew contact.
summary.zh: “reenge”不是标准单词；你很可能想写“reengage”，意思是再次参与或恢复联系。

definition.en: “reenge” is not a standard English word; it is most likely a misspelling of **reengage**.
definition.zh: “reenge”不是标准英语单词；很可能是 **reengage** 的拼写错误。

examples.en: Did you mean **reengage** (to get involved again)?
examples.zh: 你是不是想写 **reengage**（再次参与）？

definition.en: **reengage**: to become involved or interested again; to resume contact or participation.
definition.zh: **reengage**：再次参与；重新投入兴趣；恢复联系或继续参与。

examples.en: After a short break, she reengaged with her studies.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，她重新投入学习。

examples.en: The company is trying to reengage customers who stopped buying last year.
examples.zh: 这家公司正试图重新吸引去年不再购买的顾客。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次 / 重新”。所以 **reengage** 可以理解为“再次 engage（参与/投入）”。
常见搭配：reengage with + 人/事（重新与……建立联系/重新投入……）；reengage customers/audience（重新吸引顾客/观众）。

summary.en: Reengineer means to redesign something in a major, systematic way to improve how it works, especially a process or system.
summary.zh: Reengineer 指对事物（尤指流程或系统）进行重大、系统性的重新设计/再造，以提升运作效果。

definition.en: to design again or change something in a major way to make it work better (often by improving the structure, process, or technology)
definition.zh: （通常指通过改造结构、流程或技术）重新设计/重大改造，使其运行得更好

examples.en: The company reengineered its hiring process to reduce bias and speed up decisions.
examples.zh: 公司对招聘流程进行了再造，以减少偏见并加快决策。

examples.en: Engineers reengineered the engine to improve fuel efficiency.
examples.zh: 工程师对发动机进行了重新工程设计，以提高燃油效率。

definition.en: (business) to radically redesign a workflow or organization in order to achieve big improvements in cost, quality, or speed
definition.zh: （商业）对工作流程或组织进行彻底再造，以在成本、质量或速度上实现显著提升

examples.en: After the merger, they reengineered the supply chain to cut delivery time in half.
examples.zh: 合并后，他们对供应链进行了流程再造，把交付时间缩短了一半。

examples.en: The bank reengineered customer service around online support.
examples.zh: 这家银行围绕线上支持对客户服务进行了再造。

extraExplanation: “reengineer”常用于强调“幅度大、系统性强”的改造，比“redesign”（重新设计）更像“从底层结构/流程重做”。
在商业语境里常见搭配是“reengineer a process / workflow / supply chain”，与“business process reengineering (BPR，业务流程再造)”相关；语气通常表示显著提升效率或降低成本。
写作上它偏正式，日常口语中有时会用“rework / revamp”来表达更轻量的改动。

summary.en: Reengineering means radically redesigning and improving an existing system or process, especially in business or engineering.
summary.zh: Reengineering 指对已有系统或流程进行彻底再设计与改造，常见于商业与工程/软件领域。

definition.en: The process of redesigning or radically improving a system, product, or organization—often to make it faster, cheaper, or more effective.
definition.zh: 对系统、产品或组织进行重新设计或彻底改造的过程，通常为了更快、更省成本或更有效。

examples.en: The company began reengineering its supply chain to reduce delivery time.
examples.zh: 公司开始对供应链进行再造，以缩短交货时间。

examples.en: Reengineering the app improved performance and lowered maintenance costs.
examples.zh: 对这个应用进行重构/再造提高了性能，并降低了维护成本。

definition.en: In business, a major redesign of workflows and processes (often called “business process reengineering”) to achieve dramatic improvements in quality, cost, or speed.
definition.zh: 在商业领域，对工作流程和业务流程进行大幅重组（常称“业务流程再造”），以在质量、成本或速度上获得显著提升。

examples.en: After reengineering, approvals that took weeks were finished in two days.
examples.zh: 流程再造后，以前要花几周的审批两天就完成了。

examples.en: The bank’s reengineering focused on removing unnecessary steps for customers.
examples.zh: 这家银行的流程再造重点是为客户去掉不必要的步骤。

definition.en: In engineering or software, restructuring and improving an existing design or codebase (similar to redesigning from the inside).
definition.zh: 在工程或软件领域，对已有设计或代码进行重新结构化与改进（类似从内部重新设计）。

examples.en: They postponed new features to prioritize reengineering the core system.
examples.zh: 他们推迟了新功能，把核心系统的重构/再造放在优先位置。

examples.en: Reengineering legacy code can reduce bugs and security risks.
examples.zh: 对遗留代码进行重构/再造可以减少漏洞和安全风险。

extraExplanation: “reengineering”由 re-（再次）+ engineering（工程/设计）构成，强调“彻底重做/大改造”，比一般的 “improvement（改进）” 更激进。
在商业语境中常见搭配：business process reengineering (BPR)（业务流程再造）。90年代该词在管理学中很流行，但也常与裁员、组织重组联系在一起，因此在沟通时可注意措辞。
在软件领域有时会与 “refactoring（重构）” 混用：refactoring 通常指不改变外部功能、主要改善代码结构；reengineering 往往范围更大，可能伴随架构、数据模型或流程的重做。

summary.en: Reengrave means to engrave something again (literally), and it can also mean to make a memory or idea feel strongly impressed again (figuratively).
summary.zh: reengrave 指“重新雕刻/再刻一次”，也可比喻“把记忆或观念再次深深刻在心里”。

definition.en: to engrave again; to cut letters, designs, or patterns into a hard surface a second time (often to restore, correct, or update the original engraving)
definition.zh: 重新雕刻；再次在金属、石头、木头等坚硬表面刻字或刻图案（常用于修复、纠正或更新原有刻痕）

examples.en: The jeweler reengraved the ring after the date was entered incorrectly.
examples.zh: 日期刻错后，珠宝匠把戒指重新刻了一遍。

examples.en: Over time the inscription faded, so they reengraved the plaque.
examples.zh: 铭文久了变模糊了，所以他们把牌匾重新雕刻。

definition.en: (figurative) to impress an idea, feeling, or memory strongly again, as if carving it into the mind
definition.zh: （比喻）把某种想法、感受或记忆再次深深刻在心里

examples.en: Reading her old letters reengraved the grief in his mind.
examples.zh: 重读她以前的信，让他的悲伤再次深深刻在心里。

examples.en: The memorial reengraved the lesson of the disaster for the whole town.
examples.zh: 纪念活动让全镇再次深刻记住那场灾难的教训。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，常见于 rebuild（重建）、rewrite（重写）、repaint（重新粉刷）。
engrave 指“刻上去”的动作，常见搭配有 engrave a name/date/message（刻名字/日期/信息）。reengrave 通常用于原刻痕需要修复、改正或更新的场景。

summary.en: Reengraved means engraved again, usually to restore or update the original inscription or design.
summary.zh: Reengraved 指“重新雕刻/重新刻字”，多用于修复或更新原有刻字或图案。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of reengrave: to engrave something again (often to restore, update, or replace the original engraving).
definition.zh: reengrave 的过去式/过去分词：把某物再次雕刻（常指修复、更新或替换原来的刻字/雕刻）。

examples.en: The jeweler reengraved the wedding band after the letters wore down.
examples.zh: 字母磨损后，珠宝匠把结婚戒指重新刻字。

examples.en: We reengraved the trophy with this year’s winner.
examples.zh: 我们在奖杯上重新刻上了今年的获奖者名字。

definition.en: describing something that has had its engraving done again.
definition.zh: （形容）指已经被重新雕刻/重新刻字过的。

examples.en: The reengraved plaque looks clearer than the old one.
examples.zh: 这块重新刻过的牌匾看起来比旧的更清晰。

examples.en: He kept the reengraved coin in a protective case.
examples.zh: 他把那枚重新雕刻过的硬币放在保护盒里。

extraExplanation: “Engrave”通常指在金属、木头、玻璃等硬质材料上用工具刻出文字或图案；“re-”表示“再次/重新”，所以 reengrave 常见于戒指刻字、奖杯刻名、纪念牌修复等语境。

summary.en: Reengraving means engraving something again, or the new engraved version made by doing so.
summary.zh: Reengraving 指把某物重新雕刻/再刻印，或指由此产生的新版刻印品。

definition.en: the act or process of engraving something again (often to refresh, repair, or update an existing engraving)
definition.zh: 重新雕刻；再度刻印（常指为修复、更新或让原有雕刻更清晰）

examples.en: The museum funded the reengraving of the damaged plaque.
examples.zh: 博物馆出资把损坏的铭牌重新雕刻了一遍。

examples.en: After years of wear, the ring needed reengraving to make the names readable again.
examples.zh: 磨损多年后，这枚戒指需要重新刻字，让名字再次清晰可读。

definition.en: a new or revised engraved version of something (such as a plate, plaque, or design)
definition.zh: 重新刻制的版本；新版刻印品（如新版雕版、铭牌或图案）

examples.en: The publisher released a reengraving of the original illustration for the anniversary edition.
examples.zh: 出版社为周年纪念版推出了原插画的重新刻制版本。

examples.en: Collectors can compare the reengraving with earlier prints to see what changed.
examples.zh: 收藏者可以把新版刻印与早期印刷品对比，看看有哪些变化。

definition.en: present participle of reengrave: to engrave something again
definition.zh: reengrave 的现在分词：把某物再次雕刻/重新刻印

examples.en: They are reengraving the trophy because the old lettering was misspelled.
examples.zh: 他们正在重新刻奖杯，因为旧的刻字拼写错了。

examples.en: The artisan is reengraving the metal plate with a sharper tool.
examples.zh: 工匠正在用更锋利的工具重新雕刻金属牌。

extraExplanation: 词形提示：re- 表示“再次/重新”，engrave 表示“雕刻/刻印”。所以 reengrave / reengraving 常用于“修复刻字”“更新信息”“纠正错误拼写”等场景。
使用场景小提醒：在日常生活中更常说 re-engrave / reengrave（动词），而 reengraving（名词）多见于较正式的语境，比如博物馆、出版、奖杯铭牌、金属铭牌等。

summary.en: Reengross means to engross again—either to capture attention again or to rewrite a formal document again in its final form.
summary.zh: reengross 指“再次使人全神贯注”，也可指（法律/正式文件）“重新誊写定稿”。

definition.en: to absorb (someone) again so they pay close attention; to occupy the mind completely again
definition.zh: 再次使（某人）全神贯注；再次占据（某人）的注意力/心思

examples.en: After the interruption, the novel quickly reengrossed her.
examples.zh: 被打断之后，那本小说很快又让她重新沉浸其中。

examples.en: Music helped reengross him in his work.
examples.zh: 音乐帮助他重新投入到工作中。

definition.en: to prepare a formal document again in its final written form (especially in legal or official contexts)
definition.zh: （尤指法律/正式文本）重新誊写定稿；再次制作正式誊清本

examples.en: The contract had to be reengrossed after the last-minute changes.
examples.zh: 合同在最后一刻改动后必须重新誊写定稿。

examples.en: They reengrossed the bill so it could be filed properly.
examples.zh: 他们将法案重新誊清定稿，以便正式提交备案。

extraExplanation: “engross”除了“使全神贯注”之外，在法律与文书语境里还指把文件“誊清成最终正式版本”（过去常用手写、羊皮纸等）。因此“reengross”多见于正式写作或法律流程，表示因为修改而需要“重新誊清/重新定稿”。
拼写上也常写作“re-engross”（加连字符），意思相同。

summary.en: Re-enjoin means to command again or to reimpose an instruction, especially in formal or legal contexts.
summary.zh: Re-enjoin 指“再次下令/重申要求”，常用于正式或法律语境。

definition.en: to order or command again; to reimpose a rule, duty, or instruction (often in formal or legal writing)
definition.zh: 再次命令；重申（规则、义务或指示）（常见于正式或法律语境）

examples.en: The judge re-enjoined the company to stop dumping waste into the river.
examples.zh: 法官再次命令该公司停止向河里倾倒废物。

examples.en: The school re-enjoined students to wear ID cards at all times.
examples.zh: 学校再次要求学生随时佩戴学生证。

extraExplanation: “re-enjoin”是比较少见、偏正式的词，常出现在法律文件或公告中，含义接近“再次发布禁令/再次下令”。
注意不要和“rejoin”（重新加入/回到谈话）混淆；两者拼写接近但意思不同。

summary.en: “Reenjoy” means to enjoy something again.
summary.zh: “Reenjoy”表示“再次享受/重新体验并感到愉快”。

definition.en: to enjoy something again, often because you are experiencing it for a second (or later) time
definition.zh: 再次享受；重新体验并感到愉快（常指第二次或之后再经历同一事物）

examples.en: I reread my favorite novel every few years to reenjoy the story.
examples.zh: 我每隔几年会重读一次最喜欢的小说，好再次享受那个故事。

examples.en: After the renovation, we could reenjoy the park like before.
examples.zh: 翻新后，我们又能像以前一样重新享受那个公园了。

extraExplanation: “reenjoy”由前缀 re-（表示“再次”）+ enjoy 组成，意思直观，但在日常英语里不算非常常用；很多时候母语者更常说 enjoy again / rediscover / relive / reexperience 来表达同样意思。
拼写上注意：re- + enjoy 通常写成一个词 reenjoy；有时也会看到 re-enjoy（加连字符），尤其在需要强调词结构或排版风格时。

summary.en: “Reenjoyed” means you enjoyed something again.
summary.zh: “Reenjoyed”表示你再次享受了某事物。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “reenjoy”: to enjoy something again (often after time has passed or when returning to it).
definition.zh: “reenjoy”的过去式/过去分词：再次享受、重新体会某事物（常指隔了一段时间后重温）。

examples.en: I reenjoyed the book when I reread it years later.
examples.zh: 多年后我重读这本书时，又重新享受到了它的魅力。

examples.en: We reenjoyed the city after coming back in spring.
examples.zh: 春天回来后，我们又重新享受了这座城市。

extraExplanation: “reenjoyed”来自前缀 re-（再、重新）+ enjoy（享受）。在日常英语中这个词不算常见，很多人更常说：enjoy it again / enjoy it all over again / rediscover the enjoyment of ... 。如果你在写作中用“reenjoyed”，会显得更书面或更有强调“再次享受”的意味。

summary.en: “Reenjoying” means enjoying something again.
summary.zh: “Reenjoying”表示“再次享受某事、重新获得乐趣”。

definition.en: enjoying something again; getting pleasure from something a second time (often after a break or after seeing/doing it before)
definition.zh: 再次享受；重新从某事中获得乐趣（常指隔了一段时间后又看/做一次）

examples.en: I’m reenjoying this novel now that I’m older.
examples.zh: 我长大后重新读这本小说，又重新享受到了它的乐趣。

examples.en: After the injury, she started reenjoying running little by little.
examples.zh: 受伤之后，她一点一点地重新享受跑步。

examples.en: He’s reenjoying the quiet of his hometown after years in the city.
examples.zh: 在城市多年后，他重新享受家乡的宁静。

extraExplanation: “reenjoying”来自动词“re-enjoy / reenjoy”，意思是“再次享受”。这个词在日常英语里不算常见，人们更常说“enjoying it again”“enjoying it all over again”。
写法上既可写作“re-enjoying”（更清晰，强调re-前缀），也可写作“reenjoying”（更紧凑）。

summary.en: Reenjoyment means enjoying something again—renewed enjoyment.
summary.zh: Reenjoyment 指“再次享受某事”，也就是“重新获得的愉悦”。

definition.en: the feeling or experience of enjoying something again; renewed enjoyment
definition.zh: 再次享受某事的感受或经历；重新获得的愉悦

examples.en: Reading the book years later brought a surprising reenjoyment of the story.
examples.zh: 多年后再读那本书，让我意外地重新享受起这个故事。

examples.en: After the injury healed, she felt reenjoyment in running.
examples.zh: 伤愈之后，她重新享受起跑步的乐趣。

extraExplanation: “reenjoyment”由前缀 re-（再次）+ enjoy（享受）+ -ment（名词后缀）构成，意思很直观，但在日常英语里不算常用；很多时候更自然的表达是 “enjoy … again / renewed enjoyment / rediscovered pleasure”。

summary.en: “Reenjoys” means “enjoys again” (third-person singular of reenjoy).
summary.zh: “reenjoys” 意为“再次享受/重新获得乐趣”，是 reenjoy 的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: to enjoy something again; to take pleasure in a familiar experience a second (or later) time
definition.zh: 再次享受；重新从某事中获得乐趣（再体验一次或多次）

examples.en: She reenjoys her favorite movie every winter.
examples.zh: 她每年冬天都会重新享受（再看一次）她最喜欢的电影。

examples.en: After years away, he reenjoys the taste of home-cooked food.
examples.zh: 离开多年后，他再次享受到了家常菜的味道。

extraExplanation: “reenjoys” 是动词 “reenjoy” 的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it reenjoys）。
“reenjoy” 不算非常常见；更自然、口语里更常用的表达有：“enjoy again / enjoy it again / rediscover (the joy of)”。
前缀 “re-” 表示“再一次、重新”，常见于 rebuild（重建）、rewrite（重写）、rethink（重新思考）。

summary.en: Reenlarge means “to enlarge again.”
summary.zh: Reenlarge 的意思是“再次放大 / 再扩大”。

definition.en: to make something large again; to enlarge something a second time (often after it was reduced or shrunk)
definition.zh: 再次把某物变大；把某物再放大一次（常指先缩小后再放大）

examples.en: I had to reenlarge the photo because the first version was too small to read.
examples.zh: 我得把照片再放大一次，因为第一版太小看不清。

examples.en: After the shirt shrank in the wash, she tried to reenlarge it by stretching it carefully.
examples.zh: 衣服洗后缩水了，她试着小心拉伸把它再撑大一点。

extraExplanation: “reenlarge”由前缀 re-（再一次）+ enlarge（放大/扩大）组成，意思很直观，但在日常英语中不算常见。更常见的说法是 “enlarge again / make it bigger again”。
在图像处理、印刷、复印等语境里更容易见到，例如把缩小过的图片或文件“再放大”。需要注意：反复放大图片可能会导致画质变糊（像素化）。

summary.en: “Reenlarged” means made larger again—enlarged a second time.
summary.zh: “reenlarged”表示“再次变大/重新放大”，即第二次（或重新）扩大。

definition.en: made larger again; enlarged for a second time (often after being reduced or shrunk).
definition.zh: 再次变大；被重新放大（常指先被缩小后又放大）。

examples.en: The photo was reduced for the website and later reenlarged for printing.
examples.zh: 这张照片为了网站先被缩小，后来为了打印又被重新放大。

examples.en: After the repairs, the opening was reenlarged to its original size.
examples.zh: 修复后，开口又被重新扩大到原来的尺寸。

definition.en: past form of “reenlarge”: to enlarge again.
definition.zh: “reenlarge”的过去式/过去分词：再次扩大、重新放大。

examples.en: They reenlarged the diagram so everyone could read it.
examples.zh: 他们把图表重新放大，方便大家阅读。

extraExplanation: “reenlarge”并不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的表达是“enlarge again / enlarge it back / re-enlarge（带连字符）”。在图像处理、排版、打印等语境中偶尔会见到“reenlarged”。

summary.en: Reenlargement means enlarging something again, often referring to making a new larger photo or print from an earlier version.
summary.zh: Reenlargement 指“再次放大/重新放大”，常用于摄影或印刷中把已有版本重新制作成更大的尺寸。

definition.en: the act or process of enlarging something again, especially making a new larger copy from an earlier version (often used in photography or printing)
definition.zh: 再次放大；重新放大（尤指在摄影或印刷中，从先前版本重新制作更大的副本）

examples.en: The photographer did a reenlargement of the old negative to create a bigger print.
examples.zh: 摄影师把旧底片重新放大，做出了一张更大的照片。

examples.en: After the design changed, we requested a reenlargement of the poster for the new display.
examples.zh: 设计改动后，我们要求把海报重新放大，用于新的展示。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，更多时候人们会用更常见的表达：re-enlargement（带连字符）、enlargement again，或在摄影语境里直接说 make a larger print / reprint at a larger size。
在暗房摄影里，enlargement 指从底片（negative）放大成照片；reenlargement 则强调“已经放大过一次/已有成品后，再次放大”。

summary.en: “Reenlarges” means “makes something larger again.”
summary.zh: “Reenlarges”意思是“再次把某物放大/重新扩大”。

definition.en: to make something larger again (for example, to enlarge a photo or image a second time, or to restore something to a larger size after it was reduced)
definition.zh: 再次把某物放大；重新扩大（例如把照片/图像再放大一次，或在缩小后恢复到更大的尺寸）

examples.en: The editor reenlarges the image to highlight the details.
examples.zh: 编辑把图像再次放大，以突出细节。

examples.en: If the scan looks too small, the software reenlarges it automatically.
examples.zh: 如果扫描件看起来太小，软件会自动重新放大。

extraExplanation: “reenlarges”是动词“reenlarge”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it reenlarges）。
前缀“re-”表示“再一次、重新”，加在“enlarge（放大/扩大）”前，就构成“reenlarge（再次放大/重新扩大）”。

summary.en: “Reenlarging” means enlarging something again, especially an image or document.
summary.zh: “reenlarging”指把某物再次放大，尤其常用于图像或文件。

definition.en: making something larger again; enlarging again (often used for photos, documents, or images).
definition.zh: 把某物再次放大；再度扩大（常用于照片、文件或影像）。

examples.en: The designer is re-enlarging the logo so it will be readable on the poster.
examples.zh: 设计师正在把标志再次放大，这样海报上才看得清。

examples.en: After cropping the picture, she tried re-enlarging it, but it looked blurry.
examples.zh: 裁剪照片后，她想再放大，但看起来变模糊了。

definition.en: increasing the size, amount, or importance of something again (more general use, less common).
definition.zh: 再次增加某物的规模、数量或重要性（较泛用，但不太常见）。

examples.en: They are re-enlarging the park after years of budget cuts.
examples.zh: 在多年预算削减后，他们正在再次扩建公园。

extraExplanation: “reenlarging”是动词“reenlarge”的现在分词/动名词形式。实际写作中更常见的拼法是加连字符“re-enlarging”，以便读者一眼看出“re-（再次）+ enlarge（放大）”。
在摄影、打印、排版与图像编辑语境里很常见：先缩小/裁剪/压缩后，再次放大（但画质可能下降）。

summary.en: Reenlighted is a rare form meaning “illuminated again,” and sometimes figuratively “enlightened again.”
summary.zh: Reenlighted 很少见，主要表示“再次被照亮”，有时也可比喻为“再次获得启发/领悟”。

definition.en: (Rare) lit or illuminated again; made bright again.
definition.zh: （罕见）再次点亮的；重新被照亮的。

examples.en: After the power came back, the hallway was reenlighted within seconds.
examples.zh: 电力恢复后，走廊几秒钟内就再次被照亮了。

examples.en: The restored lamps reenlighted the old theater sign.
examples.zh: 修复后的灯让老剧院的招牌重新亮了起来。

definition.en: (Figurative, rare) given renewed clarity or understanding; “enlightened again.”
definition.zh: （比喻，罕见）重新获得启发的；再次明白过来的。

examples.en: Reading her letters, he felt reenlighted about what truly mattered.
examples.zh: 读着她的信，他对真正重要的事又重新有了领悟。

examples.en: The discussion left the team reenlighted and focused.
examples.zh: 这场讨论让团队重新开阔思路并更专注。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of the rare verb “reenlight” (to illuminate again).
definition.zh: 罕见动词“reenlight”（再次照亮）的过去式/过去分词。

examples.en: They reenlighted the stage after the blackout.
examples.zh: 停电后他们把舞台又重新点亮了。

extraExplanation: “reenlighted”在现代英语里非常少见。写作中更常用：re-lit / relit（重新点燃、重新点亮）、re-illuminated（重新照亮）。
如果你想表达“项目再次获批/重新启动”，英语里通常说 re-greenlit（电影/电视项目被再次“开绿灯”批准），而不是 reenlighted。
拼写上也有人把“re-enlightened（重新启发/再度开悟）”误写成“reenlighted”。可以根据语境选择更地道的词。

summary.en: “Reenlighten” means to enlighten or clarify something again (and rarely, to light up again).
summary.zh: “Reenlighten”指再次启发或重新讲明（少见时也可指再次照亮）。

definition.en: to enlighten again; to help someone understand something clearly once more (often by explaining it in a new or simpler way)
definition.zh: 再次启发；让人重新明白（通常指用新的或更简单的方式再解释一遍）

examples.en: The teacher reenchlightened the concept by using a simple drawing.
examples.zh: 老师用一幅简单的图再次把这个概念讲明白。

examples.en: Reading the book years later reenchlightened me about what truly matters.
examples.zh: 多年后再读这本书，让我重新明白什么才真正重要。

definition.en: to illuminate again; to light up something once more (rare, usually figurative)
definition.zh: 再次照亮；重新点亮（较少见，多为比喻用法）

examples.en: A single candle reenchlightened the room after the power returned.
examples.zh: 来电后，一支蜡烛又把房间重新照亮了。

extraExplanation: “reenlighten”并不是非常常见的标准词，更常用的表达是 **re-enlighten**（加连字符）或直接说 **enlighten again / clarify again / shed new light on**。在正式写作中，如果担心读者不熟悉这个词，建议用更常见的替代说法。
构词上它是 **re-（再次）+ enlighten（启发/使明白）**。注意拼写：常见的是 **re-enlighten**，以避免读起来像“reen + lighten”。

summary.en: Reenlightened means “enlightened again,” describing renewed understanding or clarity; it can also be the past form of reenlighten.
summary.zh: reenlightened 意为“再次被启发/重新觉悟”，形容重新获得理解或清晰感；也可作 reenlighten 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: Enlightened again; having regained understanding, clarity, or hope after confusion or discouragement.
definition.zh: 再次获得启发/觉悟的；在迷茫或低落之后重新得到理解、清晰感或希望的。

examples.en: After rereading the book years later, she felt reenlightened about what really matters.
examples.zh: 多年后重读那本书，她感觉自己又被启发了一次，明白什么才真正重要。

examples.en: The mentor’s advice left him reenlightened and ready to start over.
examples.zh: 导师的建议让他重新豁然开朗，准备从头开始。

definition.en: Past form of “reenlighten”: to enlighten again; to help someone understand something once more.
definition.zh: “reenlighten”的过去式/过去分词：再次启发；让某人重新理解某事。

examples.en: The documentary reenlightened many viewers about the history they had forgotten.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片让许多观众对自己遗忘的历史重新获得认识。

examples.en: I was reenlightened by a simple explanation from a friend.
examples.zh: 朋友一个简单的解释让我又明白了。

extraExplanation: “reenlightened”不是常见词，更自然的表达通常是 “re-enlightened” 或直接用 “enlightened again / newly enlightened / regained clarity”。
构词：re-（再次）+ enlightened（受到启发的/开明的）。它多用于强调“重新获得领悟”，常见于写作、演讲或较文艺的语境，而不是日常口语。

summary.en: “Reenlightening” is an uncommon word meaning enlightening again—renewing understanding or insight.
summary.zh: “Reenlightening”是不常见的词，意思是“再次启迪/重新开窍”，让理解或领悟重新出现。

definition.en: (Uncommon) the act of enlightening someone again; giving new understanding or insight after it was lost or forgotten.
definition.zh: （不常见）再次启迪/再度开导：在理解被遗忘或失去后，再次带来新的认识或领悟。

examples.en: Reading the book after ten years felt like a reenlightening experience.
examples.zh: 十年后再读那本书，感觉像一次重新被启迪的经历。

examples.en: The mentor’s advice was reenlightening—suddenly the problem made sense again.
examples.zh: 导师的建议让人重新开窍——问题突然又说得通了。

definition.en: (Uncommon) enlightening again; helping someone understand something anew.
definition.zh: （不常见）再次启迪的；让人重新理解、重新开悟的。

examples.en: It was a reenlightening conversation for both of us.
examples.zh: 那次谈话对我们俩来说都是一次重新被启迪的对话。

examples.en: The course offers reenlightening perspectives on everyday habits.
examples.zh: 这门课为日常习惯提供了让人重新开眼界的视角。

synonyms: helping (someone) see in a new light
extraExplanation: “reenlightening”在现代英语里非常少见，读者更常用的是动词“re-enlighten”（再次启迪）或更自然的表达，如“help someone see it in a new light / renew one’s understanding / reawaken interest”。
构词上是 re-（再次）+ enlighten（启迪、使明白）+ -ing（名词化或形容词化）。写法上有时会见到带连字符的“re-enlightening”，可读性更强。

summary.en: Reenlightenment means a renewed enlightenment—either personal regained clarity/awakening or a revival of Enlightenment values like reason and education.
summary.zh: Reenlightenment 指“再启蒙/重新觉醒”：可指个人重新获得清明与觉悟，也可指复兴启蒙时代的理性、科学与教育等价值。

definition.en: A renewed return to enlightenment—becoming clear-minded, informed, or spiritually aware again after confusion, hardship, or forgetting.
definition.zh: 再启蒙；重新获得清明与觉悟——在迷茫、困境或遗忘之后再次变得明白、开阔或有精神上的觉醒。

examples.en: After years of stress, therapy felt like a reenlightenment—she finally understood her own needs.
examples.zh: 经历多年的压力后，心理咨询对她来说像一次再启蒙——她终于理解了自己的需求。

examples.en: Reading history gave him a sense of reenlightenment about why society values free speech.
examples.zh: 阅读历史让他对社会为何重视言论自由产生了一种再启蒙的体会。

definition.en: A movement, period, or effort that aims to revive Enlightenment-style ideas such as reason, science, education, and individual rights.
definition.zh: 再启蒙运动/思潮：试图复兴“启蒙时代”式理念（理性、科学、教育、个人权利等）的努力或阶段。

examples.en: Some writers call for a reenlightenment to fight misinformation with critical thinking.
examples.zh: 一些作家呼吁用“再启蒙”来对抗错误信息，强调批判性思维。

examples.en: The essay argues that technology needs a reenlightenment guided by ethics and education.
examples.zh: 那篇文章认为科技需要由伦理与教育引导的“再启蒙”。

extraExplanation: “Reenlightenment”不是日常高频词，更常见的表达是“re-enlightenment”（带连字符）或用更自然的说法，如“a renewed enlightenment / a return to enlightenment / renewed clarity”。
它由前缀 re-（再次）+ enlightenment（启蒙/觉悟）构成，常见于学术、评论或写作中，用来强调“再次回到理性、清晰或启蒙价值”。
如果你想表达个人层面的“重新想明白了”，英语里也很常用“a renewed sense of clarity / a new perspective / an awakening”。

summary.en: “Reenlightens” means “enlightens again”—it helps someone understand again or makes interest/meaning feel new again.
summary.zh: “Reenlightens”表示“再次启发/重新使人明白”，也可指“重新点燃兴趣、让意义再度变得鲜明”。

definition.en: to enlighten again; to help someone understand something clearly once more, or to make something feel newly meaningful again
definition.zh: 再次启发；让人重新明白；使某事重新变得有意义、令人豁然开朗

examples.en: Her teacher reenlightens her interest in science by showing simple experiments.
examples.zh: 老师用简单的实验再次点燃她对科学的兴趣。

examples.en: Reading the book again reenlightens me about why kindness matters.
examples.zh: 重读这本书让我重新明白为什么善良很重要。

extraExplanation: “reenlightens”是动词“reenlighten”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it reenlightens）。这个词非常少见；更常见、更自然的说法是“enlightens again / re-educates / clarifies / rekindles (interest)”。
前缀“re-”表示“再次、重新”。因此“reenlighten”字面意思是“再一次使人开悟/明白”。在日常英语中，常用“rekindle”来表达“重新点燃兴趣/热情”。

summary.en: Reenlist means to sign up again—most often to continue or return to military service.
summary.zh: Reenlist 指再次报名加入，最常见用法是（军队中）续签或再入伍。

definition.en: to join the military (or an organization) again by signing up for another period of service
definition.zh: （尤指军队中）再次入伍；续签服役期；再度加入（组织）

examples.en: After four years in the Army, she decided to reenlist for another contract.
examples.zh: 在陆军服役四年后，她决定续签合同再服役一段时间。

examples.en: Many soldiers reenlist because they want to keep their benefits and training opportunities.
examples.zh: 很多士兵选择再次入伍，是因为想保留福利并获得更多培训机会。

definition.en: (transitive) to enroll someone again, especially for military service
definition.zh: （及物）使（某人）再次入伍；为（某人）办理续签/再入伍

examples.en: The recruiter helped reenlist several former service members.
examples.zh: 征兵人员帮助几位退役军人办理了再入伍手续。

extraExplanation: “reenlist”常见于美国军事语境，指现役人员在服役期满后选择“续签”继续服役；也可用于更广义的“再次加入某组织”，但日常英语里最常与军队搭配。
构词：re-（再次）+ enlist（入伍/征募）。发音中重音通常在第二部分 “-list”。

summary.en: Reenlisted means “joined the military again for another term of service.”
summary.zh: reenlisted 指“再次签约入伍/续签继续服兵役”。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of reenlist) to join the military again for another period of service after your previous term ended (or is about to end).
definition.zh: （reenlist 的过去式/过去分词）指在原服役期结束（或将结束）后再次签约入伍，继续服兵役。

examples.en: After four years in the Navy, she reenlisted for another term.
examples.zh: 在海军服役四年后，她又续签入伍，继续服役一段时间。

examples.en: He reenlisted because he wanted to finish his training and support his family.
examples.zh: 他选择再次入伍，是因为想完成训练并养家。

examples.en: Many soldiers reenlisted when their contracts expired.
examples.zh: 许多士兵在合同到期后选择续签继续服役。

extraExplanation: “reenlist”几乎总是用于军队语境，强调“续签/再入伍”，而不只是一般的“再次加入某个组织”。
拼写上常见为 reenlist（美式较常见）或 re-enlist（带连字符的写法也可见于正式文体）。

summary.en: Reenlisting means signing up again for military service after your current term ends.
summary.zh: reenlisting 指服役期满后再次签约继续在军队服役。

definition.en: the act of signing up again for military service after a period of service ends
definition.zh: （军队）期满后再次签约继续服役；再入伍

examples.en: Her reenlisting surprised her family, but she said she loved the work.
examples.zh: 她的再次签约让家人很惊讶，但她说自己热爱这份工作。

examples.en: Reenlisting can come with a new contract and different benefits.
examples.zh: 再入伍通常会签订新的合同，并可能带来不同的福利。

definition.en: signing up again to serve in the military (present participle of “reenlist”)
definition.zh: （动词 reenlist 的现在分词）再次报名参军；续签继续服役

examples.en: He is reenlisting because his unit is deploying next year.
examples.zh: 他正在续签，因为他的部队明年要部署任务。

examples.en: Many soldiers consider reenlisting after their first term.
examples.zh: 许多士兵在第一个服役期结束后会考虑再入伍。

extraExplanation: “reenlist”常见于美军语境，指服役期（term of service）结束后再次签约。相关表达：reenlist for another four years（再签四年）、reenlistment bonus（续签奖金）、active duty（现役）、reserve（预备役）。在日常英语里较少用于非军事场景。

summary.en: Reenlistment means joining the military again or signing a new contract to continue serving.
summary.zh: Reenlistment 指再次入伍或签新合约继续服役。

definition.en: the act of joining the military again after leaving or after finishing a previous term of service; signing a new contract to continue serving
definition.zh: （军队）再入伍；续服役：在离开或完成上一段服役期后，再次加入军队，或签新合约继续服役

examples.en: She decided to sign her reenlistment papers and stay in the Navy for four more years.
examples.zh: 她决定签署再入伍（续服役）文件，在海军再服役四年。

examples.en: Reenlistment bonuses are sometimes offered to keep experienced soldiers.
examples.zh: 为了留住有经验的士兵，有时会提供再入伍奖金。

extraExplanation: 词形拆解：re-（再、重新）+ enlist（入伍、征募）+ -ment（名词后缀，表示“行为/结果”）。
常见搭配：reenlistment bonus（再入伍奖金）、reenlistment contract（续服役合约）、reenlistment ceremony（再入伍仪式）。
语境提示：该词多用于军事与官方/制度性语境；日常口语里更常说 “reenlist” 或 “sign up again.”

summary.en: Reenlistments are times when someone signs up to serve in the military again for another term.
summary.zh: Reenlistments 指军人再次签约入伍、续签服役的次数/行为。

definition.en: An act of joining the military again for another period of service after a previous enlistment ends.
definition.zh: （军人）在原服役期结束后再次签约入伍、续签服役的行为。

examples.en: The Army offered bonuses to encourage reenlistments.
examples.zh: 陆军提供奖金以鼓励续签服役（再入伍）。

examples.en: After four years of service, she decided against reenlistment.
examples.zh: 服役四年后，她决定不再续签服役。
